reviewText: Old school platformer.  Everything works well enough so I recommend it.  In my own opinion, the main selling point is nostalgia.  It's fun for hopping into and playing for a few levels at a time for the simple, linear gameplay of the early days.\n\nIf you're looking for something that's going to push your boundaries and blow your mind in 2016 look elsewhere!

reviewText: An older platformer. Shoot enemies and collect items. Then find an old man and give one special item to him so you can progress to the next level. I didn't like the art style, but I liked the music.\n

I always kinda liked the game.  As platformers go, it's average.  But on PCs in the early 90s, it was pretty decent.  Granted, it definitely shows its age now, but it's still easily on par with Duke Nukem (the original side scroller version) in terms of basic play control.  It has a fairly good weapon upgrade system, and the Ad-Lib music is some of the best from the time.

In this game you play as johny bravo, who forgot to put on hair gel. In this game, points you get by collecting lemons around the level and your enemies are flying snails. Did i mention that this game runs at 12 fps on my r9 280x ?
